alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued November 23 at 12:18PM PST until November 24 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Near to sub-freezing temperatures expected. Along the immediate coast, temperatures as low as 33 degrees will result in frost formation. Further inland, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 degrees. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast. Frost conditions expected along the immediate coast from Coos Bay south to Port Orford early Friday, with more widespread frost expected Saturday from north of Reedsport down to Port Orford. Freezing conditions through much of inland Coos County, including the community of Myrtle Point on Friday, expanding to include Coos Bay, Coquille, and Powers on Saturday. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PST Friday. For the second Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM PST Saturday. For the Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 9 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
